author: Muralidhara Khajane
Nagesh Prabhu
text:
The Karnataka Chief Minister (left) reiterated in the Assembly on Wednesday that the watch was gifted to him in 2015 by his friend, a surgeon based in Dubai.— Photo: PTI

Struggling against an unrelenting and embarrassing onslaught from the Opposition, Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who has come under pressure for receiving an expensive Hublot wristwatch “as a gift,” handed it over on Wednesday to Legislative Assembly Speaker Kagodu Thimmappa. The watch, estimated to be worth several lakhs, will be placed in the Cabinet Hall of the State Secretariat.

The Speaker handed over the watch to Chief Secretary Arvind Jadhav and directed him to keep it in the Cabinet Hall.

There is a tradition of keeping rare gifts given to Chief Ministers in the Cabinet Hall.

Unrelenting Opposition

However, an unrelenting BJP and the Janata Dal (S) continued to stall the proceedings of the State legislature, like it did on Tuesday, seeking a debate on the watch under the adjournment motion. But the demand was turned down by the Speaker.

‘First of its kind’

The development is being described as the first of its kind in the history of the State Legislative Assembly. Taking exception to the stance taken on the issue by Mr. Siddaramaiah and Mr. Thimmappa, the BJP alleged that Mr. Siddaramaiah had shown disrespect to the Speaker by handing over the gift in the House in an “emotional high drama.”

Making a statement on the issue in the Assembly, Mr. Siddaramaaih reiterated that the watch was gifted to him in July 2015 by his friend Girish Chandra Varma, cardiac surgeon, who is an NRI based in Dubai.

Unrelenting Opposition continues to stall the proceedings of the Assembly
title: Amid high drama, Siddaramaiah hands over watch to Speaker
